channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead Fox, 29th January
item.description:
There is a dead fox on the kerb/footpath; unfortunately, it's a real mess. Must have been hit by a lorry or something big.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 183, Erith Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hygiene Hazard infection, 29th January
item.description:
Hi, i have call few times and i have reported few weeks ago. The situation is unacceptable in the area carbidge everywhere, infection hazard, so dirty and smelly the bins and all the area for many months from October an image of abandonment from the council completely. Please urgent cleaning

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rolls Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kirdale road potholes northbound, 29th January
item.description:
Between bus stop Sydenham Station / Kirkdale (Stop E), London SE26 4NL and junction of Jews Walk, the road is so uneven and full of potholes. Being on a bus or in a car it feels like the vehicle falling apart and unsafe to drive up the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirkdale, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in access/drain cover, 29th January
item.description:
The drain/access cover has a hole in it large enough to trip on. I’m unsure of how long it’s been there. It’s located outside st.Francesca Cabrini primary school on the pavement up where the hill starts to flatten out

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned street sign, 29th January
item.description:
Street sign, not belonging to this road, has been abandoned on the public footpath near homes. This sign should be returned to the correct road and moved from the footpath causing more blockages. The barriers are a problem due to their placement for the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Midfield Way, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Broken and uneven paving outside 47, 29th January
item.description:
The tree in the grass verge has lifted the paving slabs here and broken them, causing the pavement to become incredibly uneven and a danger to pedestrians. This has been like this for a long time now and doesn't seem to ever get fixed when it is reported. Two neighbours have previously reported this as somebody from a nearby street had a fall here. It continues to pose a danger to the public so please can these be fixed and the roots of the tree sorted to prevent this in future.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Gloucester Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London

183-7, High St, Penge 'Mega Saver' supermarket frontage - red spray tag on grey low frontage plinth near Barber Boss adjoining shop. Seen 25/1/26. Streetview archive locational image attached. I think I reported this a month ago - but the tag is still there.

item.title: Private evergreen tree blocking sight of the Council warning triangle street sign (side road on right - Thicket Rd) - BT telephone exchange, Crystal Palace Park Rd nr jct Thicket Rd, Penge., 28th January
item.description:
Private evergreen tree blocking sight of the Council warning triangle street sign (side road on right - Thicket Rd) - BT telephone exchange, Crystal Palace Park Rd nr jct Thicket Rd, Penge. The tree appears to be in the grounds of the BT telephone exchange rather than those of adjoining Rebecca Court flats. Streetview archive images, March 2025, attached. Seen from moving vehicle 25/1/26. Please also raise an action regarding the red rectangular 'New Road Layout Ahead' if that is, as in the Streetview image, not facing oncoming traffic and is twisted around.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement collapse outside 45 New Oxford St / Hey Tea, 28th January
item.description:
Pavement collapse outside 45 New Oxford St / Hey Tea. Site of a dead tree now removed but the newish pavement has slumped and clearer a vehicle has driven on it now (as tree is gone) and cracked pavement slabs into sinkhole. Likely deliver drivers for the food and beverage businesses here who regular drive onto pavement to deliver goods. Today I saw a runner trip and fall here. Accident waiting to happen

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, New Oxford Street, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous stairs, 28th January
item.description:
How can this be left, these stairs are never swept, they are extremely dangerous, the leaves have been there months, bricks, glass litter! these should be maintained. I helped an elderly lady to the top of the stairs today as she struggled to manoeuvre the debris, this is an accident waiting to happen. also the potholes next to these stairs are diabolical and a serious danger to motorcyclists!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

13, High St, Penge - corner of Crampton Rd. Prolific spray tag on grey render corner wall. Seen 25/1/26
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Bridge to Windmill Bridge Junction, Penge, Greater London

item.title: BT telephone exchange, Crystal Palace Park Rd nr jct Thicket Rd, Penge. Spray tags on brick gate piers and about 1 sq.m of spray tagging on the brick building front., 28th January
item.description:
BT telephone exchange, Crystal Palace Park Rd nr jct Thicket Rd, Penge. Spray tags on brick gate piers and about 1 sq.m of spray tagging on the brick building front. Seen Sunday 25/1/26 from moving vehicle hence Streetview archive location image here. This was reported by someone else on 19/1/26 but wrongly dismissed by Bromley FMS 'as it is private property'. This is absolute nonsense. Most grafitti is on private property and is removed by this FMS service. Bromley Council's policy is to remove, free of charge to the crime victim, eyesore criminal damage grafitti visible from the public realm. Please contact BT to offer this free service and obtain consent to remove this eyesore. This is the 'broken window effect'. Failure to deal with one crime indicates apathy and tolerance of that crime and encourages more crime. Please take care of the Bromley Borough Street Scene.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
